alert.note: Alert for Tooele and Rush Valleys (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 13 at 3:07PM MDT until September 14 at 5:15AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Utah, including the following area, Tooele and Rush Valleys and the Jacobs City burn scar. * WHEN...Through Wednesday evening, with the greatest potential for heavy rainfall Wednesday afternoon and early evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of recent burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The remnants of Tropical Storm Kay will move across Utah today, bringing deep tropical moisture and ample instability that will aid in the development of showers and thunderstorms. Any storms that develop have the potential to produce very heavy rainfall capable of producing flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
